posts.content: Love how this will help people who want to actually play the game vs using it for speculation/investment, or just hoarding.

Nice!

> A new IGN interview with Lorcana's co-designer and brand manager Ryan Miller revealed one of the most important ways the upcoming Disney game plans to prioritize fans: never making cards exclusive to cons or events. Some concerns had been raised about this after D23 attendees could acquire special foil versions of the recently announced cards, but Miller stated that while the cards have a different appearance, they will function no differently than the regular versions of the cards. On the subject, Miller stated that: "I don’t like to say ‘never’ when working on a trading card game, but here I go: We’ll never do a promo card or collection that you can’t also get out of the regular product."

https://screenrant.com/disney-lorcana-pokemon-tcg-trading-card-promos/

Read first chapter of Tenmaku Cinema today and... IDK? I dig the "this ghost and I will be working on something" aspect - which reminds me of Hikaru no Go. But The first chapter didn't really get to me. Dialog was a bit meh, and art seemed a bit lackluster for.

Didn't have fanservice, but I'm not sure this is a good or bad thing, considering fanservice + art style was a strength in Shokugeki No Soma / Food Wars
Started reading Gokurakugai today. It just appeared on Shonen Jump app. First chapter was interesting, will catch up later this weekend
